content: at the back of the head the seam runs from the back of the work to the front of the work down the centre underside of the head embroider between the two needles then slip1 by slipping the eyes and nose in black embroidery thread over the next stitch on the left-hand needle purl-wise the brown part of the head onto the right-hand needle then tyb to take the sew the underside of the yarn to the back of the work between the two cream head onto the top of needles this creates a decorative horizontal bar on the neck the front of the work at the colour-change row ears sew one end of each you do not need to break the working yarn simply ear onto the top of the carry the unused colour up the side of the work head row 1 ws in blue purl tail sew one end onto the top back corner of the drop the blue yarn and join green body row 2 rs in green k1 byf slip1 tyb to the last legs sew the side edges together adding stuffing stitch k1 as you go sew the cast on edge onto the underside of the body row 3 in green purl blanket weave in yarn tails and place over the drop the green yarn and pick up blue llama s back you can sew it onto the llama if you row 4 in blue k1 byf slip1 tyb to the last stitch prefer to keep it in position k1 row 5 in blue purl row 6 to 25 repeat row 2 to 5 five more times cast off all sts in blue and break both green and blue yarns making up ⇨ note use your cast on/off tails for seaming in mattress stitch a one stitch seam allowance has been included in the pattern andy the llama copyright © 2020 amanda berry page 3 of 3
